text: Seventy-eighth session
Agenda item 25 (b)
Advancement of women: implementation of the outcome of the Fourth World Conference on Women and of the twenty-third special session of the General Assembly
Resolution adopted by the General Assembly on 19 December 2023
[on the report of the Third Committee (A/78/473, para. 24)]

78/182.	Follow-up to the Fourth World Conference on Women and full implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session of the General Assembly
The General Assembly,

Recalling its previous resolutions on the question, including resolution 76/142 of 16 December 2021, and recalling also the section of resolution 64/289 of 2 July 2010 entitled “Strengthening the institutional arrangements for support of gender equality and the empowerment of women”,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* its previous resolutions on the question, including resolution 76/142 of 16 December 2021, and *recalling also* the section of resolution 64/289 of 2 July 2010 entitled “Strengthening the institutional arrangements for support of gender equality and the empowerment of women”,
uncertainties: Paragraph contains two conjunct reinforcing verbs; captured the first in the verb fields.

text: Deeply convinced that the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session of the General Assembly, entitled “Women 2000: gender equality, development and peace for the twenty-first century”, are important contributions to the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of women and must be translated into effective action by all States, the United Nations system and other organizations concerned,
textWithHighlights: *Deeply convinced* that the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session of the {{General Assembly}}, entitled “Women 2000: gender equality, development and peace for the twenty-first century”, are important contributions to the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of women and must be translated into effective action by {{all States}}, the {{United Nations system}} and other organizations concerned,
uncertainties: "convinced" is not in the provided exhaustive list of operative verbs; treated as a preambular evaluative verb (normalized as "be convinced"). "other organizations concerned" is too vague to map to a specific entity.

text: Reaffirming the commitments to gender equality and the advancement of women made in the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and at major United Nations summits, conferences and special sessions, and reaffirming also that their full, effective and accelerated implementation is integral to achieving the internationally agreed development goals, including the Sustainable Development Goals, especially considering that, halfway through the 2030 Agenda, the world is currently failing to achieve gender equality,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the commitments to gender equality and the advancement of women made in the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and at major {{United Nations}} summits, conferences and special sessions, and *reaffirming also* that their full, effective and accelerated implementation is integral to achieving the internationally agreed development goals, including the Sustainable Development Goals, especially considering that, halfway through the 2030 Agenda, the world is currently failing to achieve gender equality,

text: Welcoming the Political Declaration adopted at the High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development (HLPF), under the auspices of the General Assembly in September 2023, which reaffirmed that the 2030 Agenda is universal in nature and that its Goals and targets seek to realize the human rights of all and to achieve gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* the Political Declaration adopted at the High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development ({{HLPF}}), under the auspices of the {{General Assembly}} in September 2023, which reaffirmed that the 2030 Agenda is universal in nature and that its Goals and targets seek to realize the human rights of all and to achieve gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls,

text: Reaffirming the commitments in regard to gender equality and the empowerment of women in the Doha Declaration on Financing for Development: outcome document of the Follow-up International Conference on Financing for Development to Review the Implementation of the Monterrey Consensus and the Addis Ababa Action Agenda of the Third International Conference on Financing for Development,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the commitments in regard to gender equality and the empowerment of women in the Doha Declaration on Financing for Development: outcome document of the Follow-up International Conference on Financing for Development to Review the Implementation of the Monterrey Consensus and the Addis Ababa Action Agenda of the Third International Conference on Financing for Development,

text: Recalling its resolution 75/233 of 21 December 2020 on the quadrennial comprehensive policy review of operational activities for development of the United Nations system, in which it called upon all entities of the United Nations development system to continue to promote gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls by enhancing and accelerating gender mainstreaming through the full implementation of the United Nations System-wide Action Plan on Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women, developed under the leadership of the United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women (UN-Women),
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* its resolution 75/233 of 21 December 2020 on the quadrennial comprehensive policy review of operational activities for development of the {{United Nations system}}, in which it called upon all entities of the {{United Nations development system}} to continue to promote gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls by enhancing and accelerating gender mainstreaming through the full implementation of the United Nations System-wide Action Plan on Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women, developed under the leadership of the United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women ({{UN-Women}}),

text: Reaffirming the Declaration of Commitment on HIV/AIDS and the Political Declaration on HIV and AIDS: Ending Inequalities and Getting on Track to End AIDS by 2030, adopted at the high-level plenary meeting of the General Assembly on HIV/AIDS, held in New York from 8 to 10 June 2021, which, inter alia, addressed the pursuit of transformative AIDS responses to contribute to gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, and reaffirming also the political declaration on the implementation of the United Nations Global Plan of Action to Combat Trafficking in Persons, adopted at the high-level meeting of the General Assembly held in New York on 27 and 28 September 2017,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the Declaration of Commitment on HIV/AIDS and the Political Declaration on HIV and AIDS: Ending Inequalities and Getting on Track to End AIDS by 2030, adopted at the high-level plenary meeting of the {{General Assembly}} on HIV/AIDS, held in New York from 8 to 10 June 2021, which, inter alia, addressed the pursuit of transformative AIDS responses to contribute to gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, and *reaffirming* also the political declaration on the implementation of the United Nations Global Plan of Action to Combat Trafficking in Persons, adopted at the high-level meeting of the {{General Assembly}} held in New York on 27 and 28 September 2017,

text: Noting with appreciation the political declaration of the high-level meeting on universal health coverage entitled “Universal health coverage: expanding our ambition for health and well-being in a post-COVID world”, held on 21 September 2023, in which it was recognized that universal health coverage is fundamental for, inter alia, achieving gender equality and empowering all women and girls,
textWithHighlights: *Noting with appreciation* the political declaration of the high-level meeting on universal health coverage entitled “Universal health coverage: expanding our ambition for health and well-being in a post-COVID world”, held on 21 September 2023, in which it was recognized that universal health coverage is fundamental for, inter alia, achieving gender equality and empowering all women and girls,

text: Welcoming progress made towards achieving gender equality and the empowerment of women, but stressing that challenges and obstacles remain in the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* progress made towards achieving gender equality and the empowerment of women, but *stressing* that challenges and obstacles remain in the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session,

text: Noting with appreciation that 2025 will mark the thirtieth anniversary of the Fourth World Conference on Women and the adoption of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, noting with appreciation also, in this regard, review activities by Governments, and noting the contributions of all other relevant stakeholders to these review activities,
textWithHighlights: *Noting with appreciation* that 2025 will mark the thirtieth anniversary of the Fourth World Conference on Women and the adoption of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, *noting with appreciation* also, in this regard, review activities by {{Governments}}, and *noting* the contributions of all other relevant stakeholders to these review activities,

text: Recalling Security Council resolutions 1325 (2000) of 31 October 2000, 1820 (2008) of 19 June 2008, 1888 (2009) of 30 September 2009, 1889 (2009) of 5 October 2009, 1960 (2010) of 16 December 2010, 2106 (2013) of 24 June 2013, 2122 (2013) of 18 October 2013, 2242 (2015) of 13 October 2015, 2467 (2019) of 23 April 2019 and 2493 (2019) of 29 October 2019 on women and peace and security and resolutions 1882 (2009) of 4 August 2009, 2225 (2015) of 18 June 2015 and 2427 (2018) of 9 July 2018 on children and armed conflict,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* {{Security Council}} resolutions 1325 (2000) of 31 October 2000, 1820 (2008) of 19 June 2008, 1888 (2009) of 30 September 2009, 1889 (2009) of 5 October 2009, 1960 (2010) of 16 December 2010, 2106 (2013) of 24 June 2013, 2122 (2013) of 18 October 2013, 2242 (2015) of 13 October 2015, 2467 (2019) of 23 April 2019 and 2493 (2019) of 29 October 2019 on women and peace and security and resolutions 1882 (2009) of 4 August 2009, 2225 (2015) of 18 June 2015 and 2427 (2018) of 9 July 2018 on children and armed conflict,

text: Reaffirming the important role of all women in the prevention and resolution of conflicts and in peacebuilding efforts, stressing the need for their full, equal and meaningful participation therein, including at decision-making levels, and noting in this regard that 2025 will mark the twenty-fifth anniversary of the adoption of Security Council resolution 1325 (2000) on women and peace and security,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the important role of all women in the prevention and resolution of conflicts and in peacebuilding efforts, *stressing* the need for their full, equal and meaningful participation therein, including at decision-making levels, and *noting* in this regard that 2025 will mark the twenty-fifth anniversary of the adoption of {{Security Council}} resolution 1325 (2000) on women and peace and security,

text: Recalling the Global Leaders’ Meeting on Gender Equality and Women’s Empowerment: A Commitment to Action, held in New York on 27 September 2015, and the pledges and commitments to gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls made by Governments at that meeting,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* the Global Leaders’ Meeting on Gender Equality and Women’s Empowerment: A Commitment to Action, held in New York on 27 September 2015, and the pledges and commitments to gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls made by {{Governments}} at that meeting,

text: Recalling also Economic and Social Council resolution 2023/11 of 7 June 2023, entitled “Mainstreaming a gender perspective into all policies and programmes in the United Nations system” in which it was reaffirmed that gender mainstreaming constitutes a critical strategy in the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling also* {{Economic and Social Council}} resolution 2023/11 of 7 June 2023, entitled “Mainstreaming a gender perspective into all policies and programmes in the {{United Nations system}}” in which it was reaffirmed that gender mainstreaming constitutes a critical strategy in the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action,

text: Taking note of the Secretary-General’s High-level Panel on Women’s Economic Empowerment,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: High-level Panel on Women’s Economic Empowerment
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Secretary-General’s High-level Panel on Women’s Economic Empowerment

textWithHighlights: *Taking note* of the {{Secretary-General’s High-level Panel on Women’s Economic Empowerment}},

text: Recognizing that the responsibility for the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session rests primarily at the national level and that strengthened efforts are necessary in this respect, and reiterating that enhanced international cooperation is essential for full, effective and accelerated implementation,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* that the responsibility for the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session rests primarily at the national level and that strengthened efforts are necessary in this respect, and *reiterating* that enhanced international cooperation is essential for full, effective and accelerated implementation,

text: Recognizing also the primary role of the Commission on the Status of Women in the follow-up to the Beijing Declaration and Platform of Action, in which the work of the Commission is grounded, and stressing that it is critical to address and integrate gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls throughout national, regional and global reviews of the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and to ensure synergies between the follow-up to the Beijing Platform for Action and the gender-responsive follow-up to the 2030 Agenda,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Commission on the Status of Women

textWithHighlights: *Recognizing also* the primary role of the {{Commission on the Status of Women}} in the follow-up to the Beijing Declaration and Platform of Action, in which the work of the Commission is grounded, and *stressing* that it is critical to address and integrate gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls throughout national, regional and global reviews of the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and to ensure synergies between the follow-up to the Beijing Platform for Action and the gender-responsive follow-up to the 2030 Agenda,

text: Welcoming the work of the Commission on the Status of Women in reviewing the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, taking note with appreciation of all its agreed conclusions, and acknowledging the need for their implementation,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Commission on the Status of Women

textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* the work of the {{Commission on the Status of Women}} in reviewing the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, *taking note with appreciation* of all its agreed conclusions, and *acknowledging* the need for their implementation,
uncertainties: "taking note with appreciation" could be considered evaluative rather than observing; here it is classified as observing consistent with the verb list.

text: Recalling the sixty-fourth session of the Commission on the Status of Women, in 2020, when the Commission undertook a review and appraisal of the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session of the General Assembly,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Commission on the Status of Women

textWithHighlights: *Recalling* the sixty-fourth session of the {{Commission on the Status of Women}}, in 2020, when the Commission undertook a review and appraisal of the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session of the {{General Assembly}},

text: Recalling also the high-level meeting of the General Assembly on the twenty-fifth anniversary of the Fourth World Conference on Women, held in New York on 1 October 2020, which demonstrated commitment to the full and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome documents of its reviews,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling also* the high-level meeting of the {{General Assembly}} on the twenty-fifth anniversary of the Fourth World Conference on Women, held in New York on 1 October 2020, which demonstrated commitment to the full and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome documents of its reviews,

text: Welcoming the political declaration on the occasion of the twenty-fifth anniversary of the Fourth World Conference on Women,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* the political declaration on the occasion of the twenty-fifth anniversary of the Fourth World Conference on Women,

text: Acknowledging the Presidents of the General Assembly at its seventy-sixth and seventy-seventh sessions for convening the Advisory Board on Gender Equality and the General Assembly Platform of Women Leaders, and encouraging greater participation of Member States in this initiative,
textWithHighlights: *Acknowledging* the {{Presidents of the General Assembly}} at its seventy-sixth and seventy-seventh sessions for convening the Advisory Board on Gender Equality and the General Assembly Platform of Women Leaders, and *encouraging* greater participation of {{Member States}} in this initiative,

text: Welcoming efforts on the empowerment of women and girls, and taking note of all international, regional and national initiatives, such as the Generation Equality Forum, which was convened by UN-Women and co-chaired by France and Mexico, in partnership with civil society,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* efforts on the empowerment of women and girls, and *taking note* of all international, regional and national initiatives, such as the Generation Equality Forum, which was convened by {{UN-Women}} and co-chaired by {{France}} and {{Mexico}}, in partnership with {{civil society}},

text: Welcoming also the strengthening of the capacity of UN-Women and its experience in achieving its mandate,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming also* the strengthening of the capacity of {{UN-Women}} and its experience in achieving its mandate,

text: Commending UN-Women for the continued support provided to intergovernmental processes, including on the linkages between sustainable development, financing for development, migration, climate change and the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls,
textWithHighlights: *Commending* {{UN-Women}} for the continued support provided to intergovernmental processes, including on the linkages between sustainable development, financing for development, migration, climate change and the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls,

text: Recalling its resolution 64/289, in which it decided that the resources required to service the normative intergovernmental processes should be funded from the regular budget,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* its resolution 64/289, in which it decided that the resources required to service the normative intergovernmental processes should be funded from the regular budget,

text: Taking note of the ongoing work of the United Nations Trust Fund to End Violence against Women,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: UN Trust Fund to End Violence against Women
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Trust Fund to End Violence against Women

textWithHighlights: *Taking note* of the ongoing work of the {{United Nations Trust Fund to End Violence against Women}},
uncertainties: Entity not in the provided list; treated as UN System and normalized as 'UN Trust Fund to End Violence against Women.'

text: Recognizing that the participation and contribution of civil society, in particular women’s groups and organizations and other non-governmental organizations, are important to the successful implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session, as well as to the gender-responsive implementation of the 2030 Agenda,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* that the participation and contribution of {{civil society}}, in particular {{women’s groups and organizations}} and other {{non-governmental organizations}}, are important to the successful implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session, as well as to the gender-responsive implementation of the 2030 Agenda,

text: Reaffirming that gender mainstreaming is a globally accepted strategy for promoting the empowerment of women and achieving gender equality by transforming structures of inequality, which is relevant to all issues considered by its Main Committees and subsidiary bodies, including in resolutions dealing with issues beyond social, humanitarian, cultural, economic and financial matters,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* that gender mainstreaming is a globally accepted strategy for promoting the empowerment of women and achieving gender equality by transforming structures of inequality, which is relevant to all issues considered by its Main Committees and subsidiary bodies, including in resolutions dealing with issues beyond social, humanitarian, cultural, economic and financial matters,

text: Reaffirming also the commitment to actively promote the mainstreaming of a gender perspective into the design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of policies and programmes in all political, economic and social spheres, as well as the commitment to strengthen the capabilities of the United Nations system in the area of gender equality,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* also the commitment to actively promote the mainstreaming of a gender perspective into the design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of policies and programmes in all political, economic and social spheres, as well as the commitment to strengthen the capabilities of the {{United Nations system}} in the area of gender equality,

text: Bearing in mind the challenges and obstacles to changing discriminatory attitudes and gender stereotypes, which perpetuate discrimination against women and girls and stereotypical roles of girls and boys and women and men, and stressing that challenges and obstacles remain in the implementation of international standards and norms to address inequality between women and men,
textWithHighlights: *Bearing in mind* the challenges and obstacles to changing discriminatory attitudes and gender stereotypes, which perpetuate discrimination against women and girls and stereotypical roles of girls and boys and women and men, and *stressing* that challenges and obstacles remain in the implementation of international standards and norms to address inequality between women and men,

text: Recognizing the importance of fully engaging men and boys, as agents and beneficiaries of change, in the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls and as allies in the elimination of all forms of discrimination and violence against women and girls, as well as in the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the gender-responsive implementation of the 2030 Agenda,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* the importance of fully engaging men and boys, as agents and beneficiaries of change, in the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls and as allies in the elimination of all forms of discrimination and violence against women and girls, as well as in the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the gender-responsive implementation of the 2030 Agenda,

text: Recognizing also the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic as one of the greatest global challenges and noting with deep concern its negative impacts on, inter alia, gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, and expressing concern with the continued emergence and re-emergence of health emergencies and epidemic-prone diseases that have a disproportionate impact on women and girls,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* also the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic as one of the greatest global challenges and *noting with deep concern* its negative impacts on, inter alia, gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, and *expressing concern* with the continued emergence and re-emergence of health emergencies and epidemic-prone diseases that have a disproportionate impact on women and girls,
uncertainties: Classifying “noting with deep concern” as observing (vs. evaluative) can be debatable; it includes evaluative language but the core verb is “note.”

text: Expressing serious concern that the urgent goal of 50/50 gender balance in the United Nations system, especially at higher professional grade levels and in non-headquarters locations, with full respect for the principle of equitable geographical distribution, in conformity with Article 101, paragraph 3, of the Charter of the United Nations, remains unmet, that the representation of women decreases progressively at higher professional grade levels and that the gap in representation is greatest and the rate of change slowest at non-headquarters locations, including in peacekeeping missions, as reflected in the report of the Secretary-General on improvement in the status of women in the United Nations system,
textWithHighlights: *Expressing serious concern* that the urgent goal of 50/50 gender balance in the {{United Nations system}}, especially at higher professional grade levels and in non-headquarters locations, with full respect for the principle of equitable geographical distribution, in conformity with Article 101, paragraph 3, of the Charter of the United Nations, remains unmet, that the representation of women decreases progressively at higher professional grade levels and that the gap in representation is greatest and the rate of change slowest at non-headquarters locations, including in peacekeeping missions, as reflected in the report of the {{Secretary-General}} on improvement in the status of women in the {{United Nations system}},

text: Taking note with appreciation of the work done to enhance the United Nations system-wide dashboard on gender parity by UN-Women and the United Nations Development Programme to strengthen system-wide monitoring and data collection by providing the latest available data, in support of the Secretary-General’s system-wide strategy on gender parity,
textWithHighlights: *Taking note with appreciation* of the work done to enhance the United Nations system-wide dashboard on gender parity by {{UN-Women}} and the {{United Nations Development Programme}} to strengthen system-wide monitoring and data collection by providing the latest available data, in support of the {{Secretary-General}}’s system-wide strategy on gender parity,

text: Welcoming the launch of the United Nations system-wide knowledge hub on addressing sexual harassment to provide a repository of resources, best practices and tools on the United Nations system efforts to prevent and address sexual harassment,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* the launch of the United Nations system-wide knowledge hub on addressing sexual harassment to provide a repository of resources, best practices and tools on the {{United Nations system}} efforts to prevent and address sexual harassment,

text: Takes note with appreciation of the report of the Secretary-General on the measures taken and progress achieved in follow-up to and implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session of the General Assembly and of the report of the Secretary-General on improvement in the status of women in the United Nations system;
textWithHighlights: *Takes note with appreciation* of the report of the {{Secretary-General}} on the measures taken and progress achieved in follow-up to and implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session of the {{General Assembly}} and of the report of the {{Secretary-General}} on improvement in the status of women in the {{United Nations system}};

text: Reaffirms the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action adopted at the Fourth World Conference on Women and the outcome of the twenty-third special session of the General Assembly, also reaffirms the political declaration on the occasion of the twenty-fifth anniversary of the Fourth World Conference on Women adopted by the Commission on the Status of Women at its sixty-fourth session, and affirms its commitment to their full, effective and accelerated implementation;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Commission on the Status of Women

textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action adopted at the Fourth World Conference on Women and the outcome of the twenty-third special session of the General Assembly, also *reaffirms* the political declaration on the occasion of the twenty-fifth anniversary of the Fourth World Conference on Women adopted by the {{Commission on the Status of Women}} at its sixty-fourth session, and *affirms* its commitment to their full, effective and accelerated implementation;
uncertainties: The verb 'affirms' is treated as an operative reinforcing verb, although it is not listed in the provided exhaustive verb list.

text: Also reaffirms the primary and essential role of the General Assembly and the Economic and Social Council, as well as the catalytic role of the Commission on the Status of Women, in promoting gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, based on the full implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session, and in promoting and monitoring gender mainstreaming within the United Nations system, and encourages the Commission to contribute to the follow-up to the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development in order to accelerate the realization of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, as well as the enjoyment of all human rights by women and girls;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Commission on the Status of Women

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Follow-up to the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development

textWithHighlights: Also *reaffirms* the primary and essential role of the {{General Assembly}} and the {{Economic and Social Council}}, as well as the catalytic role of the {{Commission on the Status of Women}}, in promoting gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, based on the full implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session, and in promoting and monitoring gender mainstreaming within the {{United Nations system}}, and *encourages* the <<Commission>> to contribute to the [[follow-up]] to the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development in order to accelerate the realization of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, as well as the enjoyment of all human rights by women and girls;
uncertainties: Treating “contribute to the follow-up” as a concrete deliverable categorized as “review” is somewhat interpretive; it could also be considered too vague to annotate as a deliverable.

text: Calls upon Governments and all other stakeholders to systematically mainstream a gender perspective into the implementation of the 2030 Agenda in order to, inter alia, contribute to the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, and stresses in this regard the importance of ensuring synergies between the follow-up to the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the gender-responsive follow-up to the 2030 Agenda;
textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<Governments>> and all other stakeholders to systematically [[mainstream a gender perspective]] into the implementation of the 2030 Agenda in order to, inter alia, contribute to the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, and *stresses* in this regard the importance of ensuring synergies between the follow-up to the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the gender-responsive follow-up to the 2030 Agenda;
uncertainties: "All other stakeholders" is broad and not mapped to specific assignee categories, so it is not extracted as an assignee.

text: Reiterates that the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session is essential to achieving the Sustainable Development Goals;
textWithHighlights: *Reiterates* that the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session is essential to achieving the Sustainable Development Goals;

text: Notes that the General Assembly, in its decision 77/568 of 1 September 2023, decided to take the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls into account in the relevant chapters of the Pact for the Future;
textWithHighlights: *Notes* that the {{General Assembly}}, in its decision 77/568 of 1 September 2023, decided to take the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls into account in the relevant chapters of the Pact for the Future;

text: Recognizes that the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the fulfilment of the obligations of States parties under the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women are mutually reinforcing in respect of achieving gender equality and the empowerment of women, and welcomes in this regard the contributions of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women to promoting the implementation of the Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women

textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* that the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the fulfilment of the obligations of {{States parties}} under the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women are mutually reinforcing in respect of achieving gender equality and the empowerment of women, and *welcomes* in this regard the contributions of the {{Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women}} to promoting the implementation of the Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session;

text: Calls upon States parties to comply fully with their obligations under the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women and the Optional Protocol thereto and to take into consideration the concluding observations as well as the general recommendations of the Committee, urges States parties to consider limiting the extent of any reservations that they lodge to the Convention, to formulate any reservations as precisely and narrowly as possible and to regularly review such reservations with a view to withdrawing them so as to ensure that no reservation is incompatible with the object and purpose of the Convention, urges all Member States that have not yet ratified or acceded to the Convention to consider doing so, and calls upon those Member States that have not yet done so to consider signing and ratifying or acceding to the Optional Protocol;

deliverables.deliverable: ratified or acceded to the Convention

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Signature and ratification or accession to the Optional Protocol to CEDAW
deliverables.deliverable: signing and ratifying or acceding to the Optional Protocol

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<States parties>> to comply fully with their obligations under the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women and the Optional Protocol thereto and to take into consideration the concluding observations as well as the general recommendations of the {{Committee}}, *urges* <<States parties>> to consider limiting the extent of any reservations that they lodge to the Convention, to formulate any reservations as precisely and narrowly as possible and to [[regularly review such reservations]] with a view to withdrawing them so as to ensure that no reservation is incompatible with the object and purpose of the Convention, *urges* all <<Member States>> that have not yet [[ratified or acceded to the Convention]] to consider doing so, and *calls upon* those <<Member States>> that have not yet done so to consider [[signing and ratifying or acceding to the Optional Protocol]];
uncertainties: Assignee normalization for “States parties” assumed as “States parties to CEDAW.” Mentioned entity “Committee” normalized as “CEDAW Committee” based on context. Treated only “regularly review such reservations” as a concrete deliverable; limiting/formulating reservations were considered too aspirational to tag as deliverables.

text: Reaffirms that States have an obligation to exercise due diligence to prevent and combat all forms of violence against women and girls, provide protection to the victims and investigate, prosecute and punish the perpetrators of violence against women and girls, and that failure to do so violates and impairs or nullifies the enjoyment of their human rights and fundamental freedoms, calls upon Governments to elaborate and implement laws and strategies to eliminate violence against women and girls, encourages and supports men and boys to take an active part in the prevention and elimination of all forms of violence, encourages increased understanding among men and boys of how violence harms girls, boys, women and men and undermines gender equality, encourages all actors to speak out against any form of violence against women, and in this regard encourages Member States to continue to support the Secretary-General’s ongoing campaign, “UNiTE to End Violence against Women”, its social mobilization and advocacy platform, “Orange the World: End Violence against Women”, and the “HeforShe” campaign of the United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women (UN-Women), as well as to support the Secretary-General’s voluntary compact on preventing and addressing sexual exploitation and abuse;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women (UN-Women)

textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* that {{States}} have an obligation to exercise due diligence to prevent and combat all forms of violence against women and girls, provide protection to the victims and investigate, prosecute and punish the perpetrators of violence against women and girls, and that failure to do so violates and impairs or nullifies the enjoyment of their human rights and fundamental freedoms, *calls upon* <<Governments>> to elaborate and implement [[laws]] and [[strategies]] to eliminate violence against women and girls, *encourages* and *supports* <<men and boys>> to take an active part in the prevention and elimination of all forms of violence, *encourages* increased understanding among men and boys of how violence harms girls, boys, women and men and undermines gender equality, *encourages* all actors to speak out against any form of violence against women, and in this regard *encourages* <<Member States>> to continue to support the {{Secretary-General’s}} ongoing campaign, “UNiTE to End Violence against Women”, its social mobilization and advocacy platform, “Orange the World: End Violence against Women”, and the “HeforShe” campaign of the {{United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women (UN-Women)}}, as well as to support the {{Secretary-General’s}} voluntary compact on preventing and addressing sexual exploitation and abuse;
uncertainties:
- Treated “supports” as a separate evaluative operative verb; alternatively, it could be read as part of the same directive clause headed by “encourages”.
- Used “men and boys” as an assignee (type: other) for the first “encourages” clause; acceptable per guidance though it is not a standard UN entity.
- Did not extract deliverables for “speak out” or “support campaigns”, as these are considered too vague/not clearly classified under deliverable types.

text: Reiterates the importance and value of the mandate of UN-Women, and welcomes the Entity’s leadership in providing a strong voice for women and girls at all levels and its efforts to support intergovernmental processes so that they fully contribute to the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls and the realization of their human rights;
textWithHighlights: *Reiterates* the importance and value of the mandate of {{UN-Women}}, and *welcomes* the {{Entity}}’s leadership in providing a strong voice for women and girls at all levels and its efforts to support intergovernmental processes so that they fully contribute to the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls and the realization of their human rights;

text: Notes with concern that UN-Women continues to draw on voluntary contributions in order to enable it to carry out its mandate of servicing normative intergovernmental processes, and emphasizes the need for the full implementation of resolution 64/289 in this regard;
textWithHighlights: *Notes with concern* that {{UN-Women}} continues to draw on voluntary contributions in order to enable it to carry out its mandate of servicing normative intergovernmental processes, and *emphasizes* the need for the full implementation of resolution 64/289 in this regard;

text: Reaffirms the important role of UN-Women in leading, coordinating and promoting accountability of the United Nations system in its work on gender equality and the empowerment of women;
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* the important role of {{UN-Women}} in leading, coordinating and promoting accountability of the {{United Nations system}} in its work on gender equality and the empowerment of women;

text: Notes with appreciation the important and extensive work of UN-Women for more effective and coherent gender mainstreaming across the United Nations system, and calls upon UN-Women to continue to support gender mainstreaming across the United Nations system as an integral part of its work and of its efforts to accelerate action across the United Nations system;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Support gender mainstreaming across UN System

textWithHighlights: *Notes with appreciation* the important and extensive work of {{UN-Women}} for more effective and coherent gender mainstreaming across the {{United Nations system}}, and *calls upon* <<UN-Women>> to continue to [[support gender mainstreaming]] across the {{United Nations system}} as an integral part of its work and of its efforts to accelerate action across the {{United Nations system}};
uncertainties: Classified "support gender mainstreaming" as a deliverable (policy), though it is somewhat broad/ongoing rather than a new, concrete task.

text: Welcomes the commitment of UN-Women to support Member States in their efforts to develop and strengthen norms, policies and standards on gender equality and the empowerment of women, as well as to integrate gender perspectives into sectoral policy and normative frameworks, in line with its mandate, and encourages the Entity to continue to promote the need to mainstream and strengthen a gender perspective in the work of intergovernmental bodies and processes, to raise awareness of the opportunities therein and to provide policy analysis, knowledge, evidence and information in support of intergovernmental deliberations in order to provide technical assistance, at the request of Member States, in strengthening a gender perspective in resolutions and other outcomes;
textWithHighlights: *Welcomes* the commitment of {{UN-Women}} to support {{Member States}} in their efforts to develop and strengthen norms, policies and standards on gender equality and the empowerment of women, as well as to integrate gender perspectives into sectoral policy and normative frameworks, in line with its mandate, and *encourages* the <<Entity>> to continue to promote the need to mainstream and strengthen a gender perspective in the work of intergovernmental bodies and processes, to [[raise awareness]] of the opportunities therein and to provide [[policy analysis]], knowledge, evidence and information in support of intergovernmental deliberations in order to provide [[technical assistance]], at the request of {{Member States}}, in strengthening a gender perspective in resolutions and other outcomes;

text: Recognizes the need to continue to strengthen the capacity of UN-Women to fully implement its normative support function;
textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* the need to continue to strengthen the capacity of {{UN-Women}} to fully implement its normative support function;

text: Also recognizes the important role of UN-Women in promoting gender equality, and the empowerment of all women and girls and the central role that it plays in supporting Member States, in coordinating the United Nations system and in mobilizing civil society, the private sector and other relevant stakeholders, at all levels, in support of the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, and calls upon UN-Women and the United Nations system, within their respective mandates, to continue to support the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action at the international, regional, national and local levels, including through systematic gender mainstreaming, the mobilization of resources to deliver positive results and the monitoring of progress with adequate data and robust accountability systems;
textWithHighlights: Also *recognizes* the important role of {{UN-Women}} in promoting gender equality, and the empowerment of all women and girls and the central role that it plays in supporting {{Member States}}, in coordinating the {{United Nations system}} and in mobilizing {{civil society}}, the {{private sector}} and other relevant stakeholders, at all levels, in support of the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, and *calls upon* <<UN-Women>> and the <<United Nations system>>, within their respective mandates, to continue to support the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action at the international, regional, national and local levels, including through [[systematic gender mainstreaming]], the [[mobilization of resources]] to deliver positive results and the [[monitoring of progress]] with adequate data and robust accountability systems;

text: Urges Member States to increase funding for the budget of UN-Women by providing, when legislative and budgetary provisions allow, core, multi-year, predictable, stable and sustainable voluntary contributions, recognizing the importance of adequate funding in enabling UN-Women to implement its strategic plan promptly and effectively, and that the mobilization of financial resources for achieving its goals still remains a challenge;
textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Member States>> to [[increase funding]] for the budget of {{UN-Women}} by providing, when legislative and budgetary provisions allow, core, multi-year, predictable, stable and sustainable [[voluntary contributions]], recognizing the importance of adequate funding in enabling {{UN-Women}} to implement its strategic plan promptly and effectively, and that the mobilization of financial resources for achieving its goals still remains a challenge;

text: Also urges Member States and encourages stakeholders, where applicable, to address gaps and challenges, take specific, measurable, time-bound actions and mobilize adequate financial resources for the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, in line with the commitments made in the political declaration on the occasion of the twenty-fifth anniversary of the Fourth World Conference on Women, including by:
textWithHighlights: Also *urges* <<Member States>> and *encourages* <<stakeholders>>, where applicable, to address gaps and challenges, take specific, measurable, time-bound actions and [[mobilize adequate financial resources]] for the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, in line with the commitments made in the political declaration on the occasion of the twenty-fifth anniversary of the Fourth World Conference on Women, including by:
uncertainties: Whether to treat the vague group “stakeholders” as an assignee (categorized as other) or omit it for being non-specific; also whether “take specific, measurable, time-bound actions” is concrete enough to count as a deliverable (here excluded for vagueness).

text: Eliminating all discriminatory laws and ensuring that laws, policies and programmes benefit all women and girls and that they are fully and effectively implemented and systematically evaluated to ensure their effectiveness and that they do not create and reinforce inequalities and marginalization;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Systematic evaluation of laws, policies and programmes
Systematic evaluation of laws, policies and programmes

textWithHighlights: Eliminating all [[discriminatory laws]] and ensuring that laws, policies and programmes benefit all women and girls and that they are fully and effectively implemented and [[systematically evaluated]] to ensure their effectiveness and that they do not create and reinforce inequalities and marginalization;
uncertainties: The subparagraph inherits verbs and assignees from the parent clause. "Stakeholders" is broad and non-specific; included as an assignee (type: other) under the inherited verb "encourage", but could be considered too vague to annotate as an assignee depending on guidelines.

text: Eliminating structural barriers, discriminatory social norms and gender stereotypes, and promoting social norms and practices that empower all women and girls and that recognize their contributions and eliminate discrimination and violence against them, including through their balanced and non-stereotyped portrayal in the media;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Eliminate structural barriers and discriminatory gender norms/stereotypes
deliverables.deliverable: Eliminating structural barriers, discriminatory social norms and gender stereotypes

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Promote empowering social norms and practices
Balanced, non-stereotyped media portrayal of women and girls

textWithHighlights: [[Eliminating structural barriers, discriminatory social norms and gender stereotypes]], and [[promoting social norms and practices]] that empower all women and girls and that recognize their contributions and eliminate discrimination and violence against them, including through their [[balanced and non-stereotyped portrayal]] in the media;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the directive from the parent clause (“urges Member States and encourages stakeholders … including by”). I assigned only Member States as assignees, since “stakeholders” is too broad/vague per guidance. Deliverable type classification is somewhat subjective; ‘policy’ was chosen for eliminating barriers and promoting norms, and ‘standards’ for media portrayal (could alternatively be treated as information_sharing).

text: Strengthening the effectiveness and accountability of institutions at all levels to promote gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, as well as ensuring equal access to justice and public services;

deliverables.deliverable: Strengthening the effectiveness and accountability of institutions

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Ensure equal access to justice and public services
deliverables.deliverable: ensuring equal access to justice and public services

textWithHighlights: [[Strengthening the effectiveness and accountability of institutions]] at all levels to promote gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, as well as [[ensuring equal access to justice and public services]];
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the directive from the parent clause: 'Also urges Member States and encourages stakeholders, where applicable, to ... including by:'. Assignee taken as Member States; 'stakeholders' is too vague to list as an assignee.

text: Mainstreaming a gender perspective across the economic, social and environmental dimensions of sustainable development, for the realization of the human rights of all and the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Gender mainstreaming across sustainable development dimensions

textWithHighlights: [[Mainstreaming a gender perspective]] across the economic, social and environmental dimensions of sustainable development, for the realization of the human rights of all and the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the directive from the parent clause (“urges Member States and encourages stakeholders … including by”). 'Stakeholders' are not a concrete assignee per the schema, so only Member States are captured. Deliverable type is classified as 'policy' for mainstreaming; other classifications (e.g., standards) could be arguable.

text: Matching commitments to gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls with adequate financing through the mobilization of financial resources from all sources;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: adequate financing for gender equality commitments

textWithHighlights: Matching commitments to gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls with [[adequate financing]] through the [[mobilization of financial resources]] from all sources;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the directive from the parent clause ('urges Member States and encourages stakeholders... including by:'). Assignee 'Member States' is inferred from context; 'stakeholders' is not included as an assignee because it is not a concrete entity per the guidelines.

text: Strengthening accountability for the implementation of commitments to gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Strengthen accountability for implementation of gender equality commitments
Strengthen accountability for implementation of gender equality commitments

textWithHighlights: [[Strengthening accountability]] for the implementation of commitments to gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits two parent operative verbs: 'urges' (Member States) and 'encourages' (stakeholders). 'Stakeholders' is not a concrete assignee per the schema, so it is omitted. Deliverable type 'policy' is used for strengthening accountability mechanisms; alternatively, it could be classified under 'standards' or 'review' depending on context.

text: Harnessing the potential of technology and innovation to improve women’s and girls’ lives and to close the development divide and the digital divide, including the gender digital divide, as well as addressing the risks and challenges emerging from the use of technologies;
textWithHighlights: Harnessing the potential of technology and innovation to improve women’s and girls’ lives and to close the development divide and the digital divide, including the gender digital divide, as well as addressing the risks and challenges emerging from the use of technologies;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the directive from the parent clause (“Also urges Member States and encourages stakeholders… including by:”). Assignee ‘stakeholders’ is not captured because it is non-specific. No concrete deliverables were extracted, as the actions (“harnessing…”, “addressing risks…”) are broad and not sufficiently specific for the deliverable categories.

text: Closing data and evidence gaps through improved regular collection, analysis and use of gender statistics, including through strengthening national statistical capacities, to strengthen the implementation and evaluation of policies and programmes;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Collection, analysis and use of gender statistics

textWithHighlights: Closing data and evidence gaps through improved regular collection, analysis and use of [[gender statistics]], including through strengthening [[national statistical capacities]], to strengthen the implementation and evaluation of policies and programmes;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative context from the parent clause "Also urges Member States and encourages stakeholders ... including by:". I captured the inherited directive to Member States (urge). "Stakeholders" from the parent is too vague to assign concretely, so it was not added as an assignee.

text: Strengthening international cooperation, including North-South, South-South and triangular cooperation, as well as public-private partnerships, to implement commitments to achieve gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls;
textWithHighlights: Strengthening international cooperation, including North-South, South-South and triangular cooperation, as well as public-private partnerships, to implement commitments to achieve gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits directives from the parent clause: 'Also urges Member States and encourages stakeholders ... including by:'. No concrete deliverable was marked since 'strengthening international cooperation' and 'public-private partnerships' are broad and not specific tasks per the deliverable criteria.

text: Calls upon Governments and the organs, relevant funds and programmes and specialized agencies of the United Nations system, within their respective mandates, other international and regional organizations, including financial institutions, and all relevant actors of civil society, including non-governmental organizations, to intensify and accelerate action to achieve the full and effective implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and of the outcome of the twenty-third special session, including by contributing to the celebrations of the thirtieth anniversary of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, as appropriate;
textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<Governments>> and the <<organs>>, relevant <<funds>> and <<programmes>> and <<specialized agencies>> of the United Nations system, within their respective mandates, other <<international>> and <<regional organizations>>, including <<financial institutions>>, and all relevant actors of <<civil society>>, including <<non-governmental organizations>>, to intensify and accelerate action to achieve the full and effective implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and of the outcome of the twenty-third special session, including by contributing to the [[celebrations]] of the thirtieth anniversary of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, as appropriate;
uncertainties: "organs" is unspecific; mapped to 'Other (Other United Nations Bodies)' under UN Organs. "financial institutions" likely refers to international financial institutions. The only concrete deliverable identified is participation in the anniversary celebrations; the broader call to intensify/accelerate implementation is too vague to code as a deliverable.

text: Decides, in order to celebrate the thirtieth anniversary of the Fourth World Conference on Women, so as to accelerate the realization of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, to convene a one-day high-level meeting of the General Assembly in the margins of the general debate of the Assembly at its eightieth session, and that the outcome of the high-level meeting shall take the form of a Chair’s summary;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: High-level meeting of the General Assembly

textWithHighlights: *Decides*, in order to celebrate the thirtieth anniversary of the Fourth World Conference on Women, so as to accelerate the realization of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, to convene a [[one-day high-level meeting]] of the General Assembly in the margins of the general debate of the Assembly at its eightieth session, and that the outcome of the high-level meeting shall take the form of a [[Chair’s summary]];
uncertainties: Assignee is implicit (the General Assembly itself) per the start sentence, so no assignee phrase appears in the paragraph text to highlight. Treated the Chair’s summary as a report-type deliverable since the decision sets the outcome format.

text: Recommends that the President of the General Assembly conduct consultations to finalize the organizational arrangements for the high-level meeting of the Assembly;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: consultations to finalize organizational arrangements for GA high-level meeting

textWithHighlights: *Recommends* that the <<President of the General Assembly>> conduct [[consultations]] to finalize the organizational arrangements for the high-level meeting of the {{Assembly}};
uncertainties: Chose to capture only 'consultations' as the deliverable (type: meeting). 'Finalize the organizational arrangements' could also be considered a deliverable, but its category is less clear; it is treated as the purpose of the consultations.

text: Looks forward to the sixty-ninth session of the Commission on the Status of Women, in 2025, when the Commission will undertake a review and appraisal of the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session of the General Assembly;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Commission on the Status of Women

textWithHighlights: *Looks forward* to the sixty-ninth session of the {{Commission on the Status of Women}}, in 2025, when the Commission will undertake a review and appraisal of the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session of the {{General Assembly}};
uncertainties: The paragraph describes that CSW will undertake a review and appraisal, but since this is not a task directed by the GA here, it is not extracted as a deliverable or with CSW as an assignee.

text: Encourages all Member States to make ambitious commitments on gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls;
textWithHighlights: *Encourages* all <<Member States>> to make ambitious commitments on gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls;
uncertainties: "make ambitious commitments" is somewhat concrete but does not map cleanly to a deliverable category; therefore no deliverable is extracted.

text: Encourages all actors, including Governments, the United Nations system, other international organizations and civil society, to continue to support the work of the Commission on the Status of Women in fulfilling its central role in the follow-up to and review of the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session and, as applicable, to carry out the recommendations of the Commission, welcomes in this regard the Commission’s continued sharing of experiences, lessons learned and good practices in overcoming challenges to the full implementation at the national and international levels and the evaluation of progress in the implementation of priority themes, and encourages the intergovernmental bodies of the United Nations system, as appropriate, to incorporate the outcomes of the Commission into their work;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Commission on the Status of Women
Commission on the Status of Women

assignees.assignee: intergovernmental bodies of the United Nations system

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* all actors, including <<Governments>>, the <<United Nations system>>, <<other international organizations>> and <<civil society>>, to continue to support the work of the {{Commission on the Status of Women}} in fulfilling its central role in the follow-up to and review of the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session and, as applicable, to carry out the recommendations of the Commission, *welcomes* in this regard the Commission’s continued sharing of experiences, lessons learned and good practices in overcoming challenges to the full implementation at the national and international levels and the evaluation of progress in the implementation of priority themes, and *encourages* the <<intergovernmental bodies of the United Nations system>>, as appropriate, to incorporate the outcomes of the Commission into their work;
uncertainties: No concrete deliverables were extracted: phrases like 'support the work', 'carry out the recommendations', and 'incorporate the outcomes' are considered too broad/vague. 'Intergovernmental bodies of the United Nations system' is normalized to 'UN System' though it could span specific UN organs.

text: Requests the entities of the United Nations system to systematically and strategically incorporate the outcomes of the Commission on the Status of Women into their work, within their mandates, and, inter alia, to ensure effective support for the efforts of Member States towards the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls, and in this regard encourages UN-Women to continue to use concrete results-based reporting mechanisms and to ensure coherence, consistency and coordination between the normative and operational aspects of its work;

assignees.assignee: entities of the United Nations system

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Provide effective support to Member States

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Commission on the Status of Women

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Ensure coherence between normative and operational work

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<entities of the United Nations system>> to systematically and strategically [[incorporate the outcomes]] of the {{Commission on the Status of Women}} into their work, within their mandates, and, inter alia, to [[ensure effective support]] for the efforts of {{Member States}} towards the achievement of gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls, and in this regard *encourages* <<UN-Women>> to continue to use concrete [[results-based reporting mechanisms]] and to [[ensure coherence]], consistency and coordination between the normative and operational aspects of its work;

text: Encourages States and all stakeholders to strengthen the mainstreaming of a gender perspective into all sectors and in all areas of development;
textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<States>> and all stakeholders to strengthen the [[mainstreaming of a gender perspective]] into all sectors and in all areas of development;

text: Reiterates its call upon the United Nations system, including the main organs, their main committees and subsidiary bodies, through forums such as the high-level political forum on sustainable development and functions such as the annual ministerial review and the Development Cooperation Forum of the Economic and Social Council and the funds and programmes and the specialized agencies, to increase efforts to fully mainstream a gender perspective into all issues under their consideration and within their mandates, as well as into all United Nations summits, conferences and special sessions and their follow-up processes;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: high-level political forum on sustainable development

textWithHighlights: *Reiterates* its call upon the <<United Nations system>>, including the main organs, their main committees and subsidiary bodies, through forums such as the {{high-level political forum on sustainable development}} and functions such as the annual ministerial review and the Development Cooperation Forum of the {{Economic and Social Council}} and the <<funds>> and <<programmes>> and the <<specialized agencies>>, to increase efforts to fully [[mainstream a gender perspective]] into all issues under their consideration and within their mandates, as well as into all United Nations summits, conferences and special sessions and their follow-up processes;
uncertainties: The phrase “main organs, their main committees and subsidiary bodies” is generic; specific organs are not named, so only the UN System and its funds, programmes and specialized agencies are captured as assignees. The deliverable is broad; categorized under policy as mainstreaming is an institutional practice rather than a discrete activity. “Call upon” appears as part of a noun phrase and is not treated as an operative verb here.

text: Calls upon States to ensure that intergovernmental processes consistently address gender perspectives in their preparatory processes and outcomes;
textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<States>> to ensure that intergovernmental processes consistently address gender perspectives in their preparatory processes and outcomes;

text: Commits to intensifying efforts to further integrate a gender perspective into the work of the General Assembly, including in plenary and high-level meetings;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: integrate a gender perspective into GA work

textWithHighlights: *Commits* to intensifying efforts to further [[integrate a gender perspective]] into the work of the General Assembly, including in plenary and high-level meetings;

text: Encourages its Main Committees and subsidiary bodies, as well as the Economic and Social Council and its functional commissions, particularly in the light of the analysis contained in the report of the Secretary-General and of the cross-cutting nature of gender equality and the empowerment of women, to intensify their efforts to make further progress in the integration of a gender perspective into their work, including, as appropriate, into their resolutions within the respective mandates of the General Assembly and each of its Main Committees and subsidiary bodies and the Economic and Social Council and each of its functional commissions, and invites the Bureaux, as appropriate, to encourage such efforts;
textWithHighlights: *Encourages* its <<Main Committees>> and <<subsidiary bodies>>, as well as the <<Economic and Social Council>> and its <<functional commissions>>, particularly in the light of the analysis contained in the report of the {{Secretary-General}} and of the cross-cutting nature of gender equality and the empowerment of women, to intensify their efforts to make further progress in the integration of a gender perspective into their work, including, as appropriate, into their resolutions within the respective mandates of the {{General Assembly}} and each of its Main Committees and subsidiary bodies and the Economic and Social Council and each of its functional commissions, and *invites* the <<Bureaux>>, as appropriate, to encourage such efforts;
uncertainties: Normalization of 'Main Committees', 'subsidiary bodies', 'functional commissions' and 'Bureaux' is not in the provided entity list; assigned custom normalized names and types accordingly.

text: Strongly encourages Governments to continue to support the role and contribution of civil society, in particular non-governmental organizations and women’s organizations, in the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session and in the gender-responsive implementation of the 2030 Agenda;
textWithHighlights: *Strongly encourages* <<Governments>> to continue to support the role and contribution of {{civil society}}, in particular {{non-governmental organizations}} and {{women’s organizations}}, in the full, effective and accelerated implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action and the outcome of the twenty-third special session and in the gender-responsive implementation of the 2030 Agenda;

text: Calls upon Governments and the United Nations system to encourage women’s groups and other non-governmental organizations specializing in gender equality and the empowerment of women to participate in intergovernmental processes, including through increased outreach, funding and capacity-building;
textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<Governments>> and the <<United Nations system>> to encourage {{women’s groups}} and other {{non-governmental organizations}} specializing in gender equality and the empowerment of women to participate in intergovernmental processes, including through increased [[outreach]], [[funding]] and [[capacity-building]];
uncertainties: Treated “increased outreach, funding and capacity-building” as concrete deliverables to operationalize the call to encourage participation; some interpretations may view them as modalities rather than standalone tasks.

text: Calls upon the intergovernmental bodies of the United Nations system to systematically request the inclusion of a gender perspective in reports of the Secretary-General and other inputs to intergovernmental processes;

assignees.assignee: the intergovernmental bodies of the United Nations system

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Inclusion of a gender perspective in reports

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* the <<intergovernmental bodies of the United Nations system>> to systematically request the [[inclusion of a gender perspective]] in reports of the {{Secretary-General}} and other inputs to intergovernmental processes;
uncertainties: Classifying the deliverable as "policy" is approximate; it is a request to include a perspective in reports rather than creating a standalone policy document.

text: Requests that reports of the Secretary-General submitted to the General Assembly and the Economic and Social Council and their subsidiary bodies continue to systematically address gender perspectives through gender-sensitive analysis, the provision of data disaggregated by sex, age and disability and the reflection of the contribution of women and girls as agents of change and of the impact of proposed policies and programmes on gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls, and that conclusions and recommendations for further action address the different situations and needs of women and men and girls and boys in order to facilitate gender-responsive policy development, and in this regard requests the Secretary-General to convey the importance of reflecting a gender perspective to all stakeholders who provide input to his reports;

deliverables.deliverable: provision of data disaggregated by sex, age and disability

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: reflection of women and girls' contributions
deliverables.deliverable: reflection of the contribution of women and girls

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: impact analysis of proposed policies and programmes on gender equality
deliverables.deliverable: impact of proposed policies and programmes

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: convey importance of reflecting a gender perspective to report contributors
deliverables.deliverable: convey the importance of reflecting a gender perspective

textWithHighlights: *Requests* that reports of the {{Secretary-General}} submitted to the {{General Assembly}} and the {{Economic and Social Council}} and their subsidiary bodies continue to systematically address gender perspectives through [[gender-sensitive analysis]], the [[provision of data disaggregated by sex, age and disability]] and the [[reflection of the contribution of women and girls]] as agents of change and of the [[impact of proposed policies and programmes]] on gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls, and that conclusions and [[recommendations]] for further action address the different situations and needs of women and men and girls and boys in order to facilitate gender-responsive policy development, and in this regard *requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to [[convey the importance of reflecting a gender perspective]] to all stakeholders who provide input to his reports;
uncertainties: The first directive (“Requests that reports… continue to…”) does not explicitly name an assignee; it implicitly targets the Secretary-General as the author of the reports, but this is not stated, so no assignee is recorded for that part.

text: Encourages Member States, with the support of, as appropriate, United Nations entities, including UN-Women, international and regional organizations and other relevant actors, to prioritize the strengthening of national data collection and monitoring capacities with regard to statistics disaggregated by sex and age, as well as national tracking indicators for gender equality and the empowerment of women, through multisectoral efforts and partnerships;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Strengthening national data collection and monitoring capacities
deliverables.deliverable: strengthening of national data collection and monitoring capacities

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<Member States>>, with the support of, as appropriate, {{United Nations entities}}, including {{UN-Women}}, {{international}} and {{regional organizations}} and other relevant actors, to prioritize the [[strengthening of national data collection and monitoring capacities]] with regard to statistics disaggregated by sex and age, as well as national tracking indicators for gender equality and the empowerment of women, through multisectoral efforts and partnerships;
uncertainties: "United Nations entities" is mapped to UN System as a general reference. "International and regional organizations" are treated as mentioned entities, not assignees, since they are noted as potential supporters rather than directly tasked.
